info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 3:43PM CDT until April 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CHRISTIAN AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES... At 342 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Billings, or 8 miles west of Republic, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 341 PM, a National Weather Service employee reported two inch hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Nixa, Republic, Battlefield, Willard, Clever, Billings, Brookline, Glidewell, Ebenezer, Turners and Galloway. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 61 and 84. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
